  • Method Details

    • acquire

      @NotNull public <R> R acquire(@NotNull T object, @NotNull @NotNull Class<R> type)
      Description copied from interface: InstanceSupplier
      Acquires an instance of the specified type based on the provided context object.

      This method is invoked during the deserialization process to create instances of target classes. The implementation can utilize the object parameter to influence the instantiation logic, such as selecting specific constructors, applying dependency injection, or applying custom initialization.

      For example, when deserializing an XML element into a Java object, the object is an XMLDocument instance containing the data to be mapped to the object's fields.

      Exception Handling:

      • MappingException: Thrown when there is an issue with the instantiation logic, such as mismatched constructor arguments or reflection failures. For example, if the number of constructor arguments does not align with the expected parameters, a MappingException is thrown to indicate this discrepancy.
      • RuntimeException: Thrown for unexpected errors that do not fall under MappingException. This could include unchecked exceptions that occur during the instantiation process, such as illegal access or invocation target exceptions that are not specifically handled.

      Implementers should ensure that MappingException is thrown for known, recoverable issues related to mapping and instantiation, while reserving RuntimeException for unforeseen, critical errors.

      Type Parameters:
      R - the type of the object to be returned
      Parameters:
      object - the context or source object that provides additional information for instance creation (e.g., XMLDocument containing data to be deserialized)
      type - the Class object representing the type of the instance to be created
      Returns:
      an instance of type R as specified by the type parameter
      See Also:
      • CachingAnnotationInstanceSupplier
